intro: Agapetes variegata var. puberula, commonly known as the variegated silverleaf evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments at high elevations. The flowers are small and white, clustered in dense inflorescences, and bloom during the cooler months of the year.
